posts.body:
>>cd2a7f37-83ad-4bb9-b7c1-18f3bbedda45
>trying to divide and conquer already
Nah, you get the [M]. So long.

>>3d7caf61-13e1-4019-b196-adf620769b34
Too much of a pain for them I think, they might shit it up for a few days and then get bored.

>>d15a3f6b-c375-4f9b-9398-2a3772964fd7
So long as I get a metal arm to crush the kikes with, I'm down.

>>5f5523c6-ecd1-4eb7-9562-c1755f542f6a
>Using Tor Browser doesn't help at all, because you with it you are generally just connecting to 127.0.0.1 (your computer) via Tor Browser. Since then everything goes via "normal zeronet". To use 0net via Tor, you need to setup Tor proxy in its settings.
I don't understand. I'm using tor browser and added 127.0.0.1:43110 to the proxy exceptions per the instructions on the zeronet website.
Every indication points to it working.

>>bda05946-bf2f-45de-a4f0-5c783cf17193
Neat idea with ram drives. Right now I'm using veracrypt, so everything zeronet related is encrypted when I unmount the fake drive.

>>5db09109-e613-4c18-af40-27c712185c55
>>c3c198a3-0e2f-4ca6-8f9b-6e95cb50bc4a
>>f6762b1b-d544-4571-b3e4-277cafdd0a54
It's nice here, and I think this place gives good incentive to not be a cunt.
It's kind of funny, now the users themselves have the power to deplatform leftyshills/spammers/blacked threads.
Actual discussion can take place. It's refreshing.

>>43efabf0-deae-4448-a8c0-846ac41aa1e7
I hadn't thought of it like that. That's kind of beautiful.

I think something weird is going on.
I was going though blacklisting some boards and shit started to get really slow, and the files updating on the homepage started growing rapidly.
We gained 500 peers in the span of 20 seconds, and it's still growing. As of this post we're at 2500.

>>61f87b75-cba0-4cd8-9577-890dd5a5f019
I don't think he can dude.
Just blacklist the q board, you will no longer seed or download any files from there. Complete disassociation.

>>447ea51a-9444-4842-bcfc-6647dd20883e
I'm just questioning the legitimacy of the traffic. Watching that number jump from 2k to 2500+ in seconds is concerning, but it seems to be holding up just fine.
Then again, if this is p2p, they're only helping, right?

>>4d8029c5-38fa-4a0a-b9eb-d940e74ba0fa
>When ((their hero)) completes his gun bans this week - they will abandon ship.
I fucking wish. I've already been reading their cope.

>>5da8ed4f-fabf-47a1-a056-d251a7ca7664
It was created to tell people like you to fuck off.
Thanks m8. I don't have the entire site set to seed, so I'm opening every image to make it seed.

>>89a563a9-885b-4b2d-ad29-0de7e0b35d34
That's exactly why I don't seed the entire site.
I was hoping there was a simple way to seed only a specific board automatically, and I was under the impression that "pinning" a board on the homepage did this but I can't get it to work.
And even if you blacklist a board, if you set the whole site to seed using the sidebar it will seed the blacklisted shit too.

>>ff16b260-3237-4a9e-ac6b-35dc62c1f2e5
I'm fine with seeding this board, just not every board.
I tried pinning and it didn't seem to work. I'll try again.
I waited until it updated and no more files were downloading, but I still had to come here and manually click on every image.

>>b485cf24-1b27-4a8d-bfb1-afdbdef88515
I'm completely burned out on the glow in the dark meme at this point.
>hey guys how do I do this completely legal thi-
>OMFG GLOW!11 GLOWINGGGG!
Every single fucking post, in /pol/ or /k/.

>>841b590f-83f1-4fb6-adce-2380a1487f12
Bullshit. I require a source, they're not that crazy. That would  also fuck up a number of industries.

>>223dd8a9-ea66-4c06-9fae-a0308e806f6b
>Please don't give up
We're not quitters.
There will be a solution.
Besides, the fool is only spamming /pol/.

Hey admin dude, what about requiring an image to post?
Or at least requiring an image to make a new thread. That's pretty standard on chans, is it a feature you can turn on here?
Along with requiring a unique image for every post?

https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroID/issues/3
Read this for ideas on how to counter this.
